Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Our client is seeking to hire a Business Development Manager to lead growth initiatives by originating new business opportunities within the power sector and Commercial &amp; Industrial (C&amp;I) markets.
	This role requires a deep understanding of the power industry including market trends, regulatory frameworks, recent policies and key stakeholders.
	The candidate will drive business origination, manage client relationships, and actively contribute to achieving the company&rsquo;s strategic objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Explore and identify potential business opportunities, new markets, and emerging trends within the Nigerian energy sector.
	Develop high-quality business proposals, pitch presentations, and tender documents to secure new projects and clients.
	Conduct thorough research on industry trends, competitor activities, and regulatory changes to inform business strategy and provide insights on potential opportunities and risks.
	Manage key clients, ensuring high satisfaction levels, addressing concerns, and maintaining long-term partnerships with existing clients.
	Lead the&nbsp;negotiation and execution of key commercial agreements, including power purchase agreements (PPAs), engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contracts, operation and maintenance (O&amp;M) etc.
	Collaborate with teams across departments to implement growth strategies.
	Provide regular updates to senior management on business development activities, market trends, and performance against targets, while contributing to the company&rsquo;s long-term strategy.
	Manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Energy Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 - 8 years of post Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in relevant field.
	A master&rsquo;s degree or professional certifications (e.g., PMP, MBA, CFA) would be highly desirable.
	Strong project management and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis.
	Ability to build and maintain strategic partnerships.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and relevant software.

	Ability to think critically and develop long-term strategies for business growth.
	Ability to spot and manage business opportunities.
	Ability to work under little or no supervision

	Focused on achieving measurable business outcomes and meeting revenue targets.
	Ability to work closely with teams including technical, legal and regulatory units to achieve business objectives.


Compensation


	Competitive salary&nbsp;(N1,200,000 monthly).
	Performance-based incentives
	Health benefits
	Professional development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter in PDF to:&nbsp;uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Business Development Manager Job at Universal Human Resource (UHR) Consult Limited




        
    

        
        Universal Human Resource (UHR) Consult Limited - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Our client is seeking to hire a Business Development Manager to lead growth initiatives by originating new business opportunities within the power sector and Commercial & Industrial (C&I) markets.
	This role requires a deep understanding of the power industry including market trends, regulatory frameworks, recent policies and key stakeholders.
	The candidate will drive business origination, manage client relationships, and actively contribute to achieving the company’s strategic objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Explore and identify potential business opportunities, new markets, and emerging trends within the Nigerian energy sector.
	Develop high-quality business proposals, pitch presentations, and tender documents to secure new projects and clients.
	Conduct thorough research on industry trends, competitor activities, and regulatory changes to inform business strategy and provide insights on potential opportunities and risks.
	Manage key clients, ensuring high satisfaction levels, addressing concerns, and maintaining long-term partnerships with existing clients.
	Lead the negotiation and execution of key commercial agreements, including power purchase agreements (PPAs), engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contracts, operation and maintenance (O&M) etc.
	Collaborate with teams across departments to implement growth strategies.
	Provide regular updates to senior management on business development activities, market trends, and performance against targets, while contributing to the company’s long-term strategy.
	Manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Energy Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 - 8 years of post Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field.
	A master’s degree or professional certifications (e.g., PMP, MBA, CFA) would be highly desirable.
	Strong project management and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis.
	Ability to build and maintain strategic partnerships.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and relevant software.


Key Competencies:


	Ability to think critically and develop long-term strategies for business growth.
	Ability to spot and manage business opportunities.
	Ability to work under little or no supervision
	Proven ability to connect with industry leaders and key decision-makers.
	Focused on achieving measurable business outcomes and meeting revenue targets.
	Ability to work closely with teams including technical, legal and regulatory units to achieve business objectives.


Compensation


	Competitive salary (N1,200,000 monthly).
	Performance-based incentives
	Health benefits
	Professional development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter in PDF to: uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Procurement Officer Job at Sahei Gender Development Initiative




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Sahei Gender Development Initiative, was formally known and called Sanitation and hygiene education initiative (SGDI). The organization is a Nigerian non-governmental and not-for-profit making organization incorporated with the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) in November 2014. It is an organization that facilitates, advocates, and raises awareness for access to improved services among vulnerable individuals. The organization focuses in the areas of WASH, Protection/GBV, Empowerment/livelihood, Waste Management, Health/Nutrition, Climate Change and Peace Building. The organization has experienced staff that are equipped with knowledge, skills to response when the need arises. The organizations staff can work all over the liberated LGAs of Borno State. The organization was established to promote well-being of individuals and alleviate the suffering of conflict affected people and the vulnerable groups of people in Northeastern Nigeria. In pursuit of its mission, the Organization works with partners to execute programs aimed at improving the livelihood and living standards of vulnerable children, women and girls, men, widows, internally displaced persons, and persons living with disabilities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Northeast, Maiduguri - Borno
Duration: 6 months (July-December) with possible extension

Job Description


	Procurement of goods and services
	Preparing all Procurement documentation
	Monitoring and evaluation of procurement
	Liaising and vendor management.
	Keeping an accurate record of the procurement register


Technical:


	Proficiency in the use of the following software: SAP ERP, MS Excel, MS Word
	Procurement and contract management
	Vendor Management.


Requirements


	First Degree in Social Sciences, Business Administration, Public Administration, Marketing or a related field
	CIPS certification will be an added advantage.


 

Note


	Interested candidates should complete and attach their CV with Cover Letter following this format “Name_ Position you applied for”.
	Only applicants whose competencies meet the requirements of the position will be contacted.
	SGDI is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality, and culture. Individuals from minority groups, indigenous groups, and persons with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply.
	Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
	SGDI reserves the right to close the advertisement before the stated closing date if a suitable candidate is identified.
	SGDI has a PSEA Policy that the successful candidate will be expected to comply with and
